name: triteness
content:

the quality of being trite (= expressed too often to be interesting): One complaint voiced about the film is the triteness of the plot. There's never a hint of triteness or sentimentality in their performance. See
trite
More examplesFewer examplesThe worst crime the novel commits is not the triteness of its ideas, but the clumsiness of its execution.The letter was written with all her usual triteness and inadequacy of expression.The triteness and immaturity of her words and attitudes embarrassed him.
